endpoint.summary: Attempts to create a donation from the posted object.
endpoint.behavior: Validates the fields in the posted CreateDonationRequest. If valid, creates a donation transaction and saves it to the database. Stores the Id of the new donation in session so the user has permissions for the donation instance. If the payment type is credit card, communicates with Blackbaud secured payment to set up a check out URI and adds that URI to the return object. For credit card payment, the donation is saved in a Pending state. For payments not using a credit card, the donation is saved in a Completed state and an acknowledgement email is sent.

parameter.name: PartId
parameter.description: Id of a donation form part.

field.name: Donor
field.description: Information about the donor of the gift. Donor and all attributes related to the donor (ex: Donor.Title) should be excluded if the donation form uses a Payment 2.0 part.

field.name: Donor.Address
field.description: Address information about the donor.

field.name: Donor.Address.Country
field.description: In order for Blackbaud Secure Payments to pre-populate international billing addresses, this value should be the full country description specified in CRM.

field.name: Donor.OrganizationName
field.description: Required if Gift.IsCorporate is true. This field is not valid if the part is configured to use a Payment 2.0 page.

field.name: Gift
field.description: Information about the donation gift.

field.name: Gift.IsAnonymous
field.description: Indicates that the gift is being made anonymously.

field.name: Gift.PaymentMethod
field.description:
Indicates the method of payment to be used for the gift. Possible values:
  • CreditCard (0)
  • BillMeLater (1)
  • DirectDebit (2)

field.name: Gift.CreateGiftAidDeclaration
field.description: Indicates whether the gift aid is applied to the donation.

field.name: Gift.Designations
field.description: Array of designation objects for the gift.

field.name: Gift.Designations.Amount
field.description: The numeric amount of the designation. The currency is dictated by the merchant account specified.

field.name: Gift.Designations.DesignationId
field.description: Id of a designation to which the amount should be allocated.

field.name: Gift.Attributes
field.description: Array of revenue attributes to be added to the gift.

field.name: Gift.Attributes.AttributeId
field.description: Id of revenue attribute. The only supported attribute data types are text, number, date, currency, yes/no, and code table. Only one per record attribute types are supported, except for code table attributes which support multiple entries per record. Any individual attribute id can only be supplied once for a donation.

field.name: Gift.Attributes.Value
field.description: Value of the attribute. For code table values, the name of the code table entry should be used. For Multiple code table entries, use a single attribute with the names semicolon delimited in the value field.

field.name: Gift.Recurrence.DayOfWeek
field.description:
DayOfWeek value is required for weekly recurrences. Field is invalid for any frequency other than weekly. Possible values:
  • Sunday (0)
  • Monday (1)
  • Tuesday (2)
  • Wednesday (3)
  • Thursday (4)
  • Friday (5)
  • Saturday (6)

field.name: Gift.Recurrence.DayOfMonth
field.description: DayOfMonth value is required for non-weekly recurrences. Field is invalid for weekly frequency. Valid values: 1-31. Months with less than 31 days will default to the last day of the month is DayOfMonth is higher than number of days in the month.

field.name: Gift.Recurrence.Month
field.description: Month value is required for annual recurrences. Field is invalid for any frequency other than annually. Valid values: 1-12; Jan-Dec.

field.name: Gift.Recurrence.Frequency
field.description:
Designates the recurrence frequency. Possible values:
  • Weekly (1)
  • Monthly (2)
  • Quarterly (3)
  • Annually (4)
  • Every4Weeks (7)

field.name: Gift.Recurrence.StartDate
field.description: Start date for recurrence. Must start on or after today's date.

field.name: Gift.Recurrence.EndDate
field.description: Optional end date for recurrence. Must end after start date.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.TributeID
field.description: Optional Tribute ID to map to. Must match Tribute ID from backoffice.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.TributeDefinition.FirstName
field.description: First name for new tribute definition.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.TributeDefinition.LastName
field.description: Last name for new tribute definition.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.TributeDefinition.Type
field.description: Tribute type to map to in backoffice. Must match existing tribute type.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.TributeDefinition.Description
field.description: Description for new tribute definition.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.Acknowledgee.FirstName
field.description: First name for tribute acknowledgee.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.Acknowledgee.LastName
field.description: Last name for tribute acknowledgee.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.Acknowledgee.Country
field.description: Country for tribute acknowledgee address.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.Acknowledgee.AddressLines
field.description: Address lines for tribute acknowledgee address.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.Acknowledgee.City
field.description: City for tribute acknowledgee address.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.Acknowledgee.State
field.description: State for tribute acknowledgee address.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.Acknowledgee.PostalCode
field.description: Postal code for tribute acknowledgee address.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.Acknowledgee.Phone
field.description: Phone number for tribute acknowledgee.

field.name: Gift.Tribute.Acknowledgee.Email
field.description: Email address for tribute acknowledgee.

field.name: Gift.IsCorporate
field.description: Indicates that the gift is given on behalf of a company. When true, the Corporate merge fields are displayed as opposed to the Individual merge fields. Cannot process if Donation Form is using a Payment 2.0 Part.

field.name: Origin
field.description: Information about the origin of the transaction.

field.name: Origin.AppealId
field.description: Id of an appeal to associate with the donation.

field.name: Origin.PageId
field.description: Id of the BBIS page hosting the donation form.

field.name: Origin.PageName
field.description: Name of the web page hosting the donation form.

field.name: BBSPReturnUri
field.description: The Uri that Blackbaud secured payment should redirect to after completing the payment. Required for credit card transactions. Exclude if Donation Form is using a Payment 2.0 Part.

field.name: BBSPTemplateSitePageId
field.description: Id of the BBIS page that should be used as the page template in Blackbaud secured payment. This page must contain certain BBSP-integrated part types for the page template to be usable, such as the Advanced Donation Form. Exclude if Donation Form is using a Payment 2.0 Part.

field.name: MerchantAccountId
field.description: Id of the merchant account that should be used to process the donation. Exclude if Donation Form is using a Payment 2.0 Part.

response.description:
A validation error was found with the post data or an error occurred in the processing. Returns an array of Errror objects. Possible Errors:
  • RecordNotFound (106)
  • RequiredFieldMissing (101)
  • InvalidFieldSupplied (102)
  • ValueBelowMinimum (103)
  • ValueExceedsMaximum (104)
  • ValueNotAllowed (105)
  • ExceedsMaximumLength (107)

Returns a CreateDonationReply object containing information about the created donation and optionally a Uri for completing payment of the donation with Blackbaud secured payment. A location header is also returned containing a Uri of the new donation object. If the part is configured to use a Payment 2.0 page, the reply will contain a URI to the selected payment page instead of a secure payment URI.

endpoint.summary: Signals the application to confirm that the donation has been paid in Blackbaud secured payment and to complete the creation of the donation.
endpoint.behavior: Ensures the user has access to this donation by finding the Id in their session. If so, loads the donation out of the database. Ensures the donation is a credit card donation and not already in a completed state. If not, then confirms with Blackbaud secured payment whether the donation is paid. If so, updates the donation status and sends the acknowledgment email.
